title: Small Business CGT Concessions

scenario_info.name: Small Business CGT Concessions - 15-Year Exemption
scenario_info.description: David operates a photography studio from a commercial property he has owned for 16 years. He sells the property and qualifies for the small business 15-year exemption, which allows him to disregard the entire capital gain. He also contributes part of the proceeds to superannuation.

expected_result.notes: 15-year exemption - entire capital gain disregarded. Can contribute to super under CGT cap.

applicable_rules: Must own active asset for 15+ continuous years
Entire capital gain exempt (not just reduced)
ITAA97 s292.100: CGT cap for super contributions
Exempt amount can be contributed to super under CGT cap

property_history.description: Photography studio established - 100% business use. Property becomes active asset.

properties.notes: Full exemption under small business 15-year rule. Owned active asset for 16.9 years. David is 58 years old. Meets all conditions: active asset 15+ years, age 55+, small business entity. Gain of $309,700 fully exempt. Can contribute exempt amount to super under CGT cap.

user_query: I've run my photography studio from my commercial property for 16 years. I'm 58 and selling the property. Do I qualify for the small business CGT concessions?
